alert.note: Alert for Brown; Clay; Cloud; Jackson; Marshall; Nemaha; Ottawa; Pottawatomie; Republic; Riley; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 01 at 3:37AM CST until January 02 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 11 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph resulting in visibility of a half mile or less at times. Very cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero expected Saturday through Sunday morning. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Kansas. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 11 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Very cold wind chills Saturday through Sunday morning could be dangerous for vulnerable populations and those that may become stranded in their vehicles.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Clay; Cloud; Jackson; Marshall; Nemaha; Ottawa; Pottawatomie; Republic; Riley; Washington
